html: As an integral part of Greater Babylon, the covenant breakers among Jehovah’s people meet Babylon’s fate. When, like Esau, they want their birthright back and are willing to slay their brothers for it (Genesis 27:41), Jehovah intervenes to cut them off from his blessings and to lay waste their habitations (Isaiah 1:7; 21:2; 24:1; 42:15). Their now uninhabitable land becomes a memorial of the damned for future generations (Isaiah 13:20-21; 14:22-23; 32:14; 66:24). The hell on earth they leave behind that is a consequence of their wickedness foreshadows the foreboding world they inherit in the hereafter.
